headline: Fed Rate Cuts Might Not Lead to Lower Mortgage Rates. What That Means for Investors.
summary: For many months, Donald Trump pushed hard for the Federal Reserve to lower rates, arguing, in part, that the move would spur refinancing activity and make housing more affordable, thereby giving the economy an added jolt.  In September the central bank cut the benchmark rate by 25 basis points ending a nine-month pause in the easing cycle.  In September 2024, for instance, the Fed slashed rates by half a point.

headline: Why D.R. Horton (DHI) Shares Are Trading Lower Today
summary: Shares of homebuilder D.R. Horton (NYSE:DHI) fell 4.4% in the morning session after Evercore ISI downgraded the stock to 'In Line' from 'Outperform' and cut its price target to $169 from $185. The downgrade occurred amid a backdrop of broader market concerns, as the housing market continued to face headwinds from affordability issues and economic uncertainty.

headline: Housing weakness due to poor demand not supply, says Evercore
summary: Investing.com -- Evercore ISI cut its ratings on major U.S. homebuilders, saying the sector’s summer rally has run ahead of reality as demand remains sluggish despite easing mortgage rates.

raw.headline: Housing weakness due to poor demand not supply, says Evercore
raw.summary: Investing.com -- Evercore ISI cut its ratings on major U.S. homebuilders, saying the sector’s summer rally has run ahead of reality as demand remains sluggish despite easing mortgage rates.

headline: D.R. Horton (DHI): Evaluating Valuation as Legal Risks Bring Fresh Uncertainty for Investors
summary: A class action lawsuit filed against D.R. Horton (DHI) and its mortgage subsidiary has put the homebuilder in focus. The case accuses the company of omitting required property taxes from initial mortgage payment estimates, which has shaken investor confidence. See our latest analysis for D.R. Horton. Even with headline risks making waves, D.R. Horton's share price has seen only modest movement, with short-term returns staying fairly steady. Over the past year, the 1-year total shareholder...

headline: 3 Cash-Producing Stocks We’re Skeptical Of
summary: Generating cash is essential for any business, but not all cash-rich companies are great investments. Some produce plenty of cash but fail to allocate it effectively, leading to missed opportunities.

raw.headline: 3 Cash-Producing Stocks We’re Skeptical Of
